chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: Type
T0: Type
f: T -> T0
s: SF_seq

Goal:
SF_ly (SF_map f s) = [seq f i | i <- SF_ly s]

Premises:
Notation seq := list
SF_map = fun (f : T -> T0) (s : SF_seq) => {| SF_h := SF_h s; SF_t := [seq (fst x, f (snd x)) | x <- SF_t s] |} : (T -> T0) -> SF_seq -> SF_seq Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
SF_ly = fun (T : Type) (s : SF_seq) => unzip2 (SF_t s) : forall T : Type, SF_seq -> seq T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _]
SF_ly_surj : forall s0 s1 : SF_seq, s0 = s1 -> SF_ly s0 = SF_ly s1 where ?T : [T : Type T0 : Type f : T -> T0 s : SF_seq |- Type]
SF_lx_ly_inj : forall s0 s1 : SF_seq, SF_lx s0 = SF_lx s1 -> SF_ly s0 = SF_ly s1 -> s0 = s1 where ?T : [T : Type T0 : Type f : T -> T0 s : SF_seq |- Type]
SF_ly_cons : forall (h : R * ?T) (s0 : SF_seq), SF_ly (SF_cons h s0) = snd h :: SF_ly s0 where ?T : [T : Type T0 : Type f : T -> T0 s : SF_seq |- Type]
map_cat : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s1 s2 : seq T1), [seq f i | i <- s1 ++ s2] = [seq f i | i <- s1] ++ [seq f i | i <- s2]
map_reshape : forall (T S : Type) (f : T -> S) (sh : seq nat) (s : seq T), [seq [seq f i | i <- i] | i <- reshape sh s] = reshape sh [seq f i | i <- s]
behead_map : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1), behead [seq f i | i <- s] = [seq f i | i <- behead s]
map_rev : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1), [seq f i | i <- rev s] = rev [seq f i | i <- s]
pmapS_filter : forall (aT rT : Type) (f : aT -> option rT) (s : seq aT), [seq Some i | i <- pmap f s] = [seq f i | i <- s & f i]
filter_map : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (a : pred T2) (s : seq T1), [seq x <- [seq f i | i <- s] | a x] = [seq f i | i <- s & pred_of_simpl (preim f a) i]
map_cons : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (x : T1) (s : seq T1), [seq f i | i <- x :: s] = f x :: [seq f i | i <- s]
map_take : forall (n0 : nat) (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1), [seq f i | i <- take n0 s] = take n0 [seq f i | i <- s]
map_drop : forall (n0 : nat) (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1), [seq f i | i <- drop n0 s] = drop n0 [seq f i | i <- s]
map_rot : forall (n0 : nat) (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1), [seq f i | i <- rot n0 s] = rot n0 [seq f i | i <- s]
map_rotr : forall (n0 : nat) (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1), [seq f i | i <- rotr n0 s] = rotr n0 [seq f i | i <- s]
map_mask : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (m : bitseq) (s : seq T1), [seq f i | i <- mask m s] = mask m [seq f i | i <- s]
map_rcons : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1) (x : T1), [seq f i | i <- rcons s x] = rcons [seq f i | i <- s] (f x)
belast_map : forall (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1) (x : T1), seq.belast (f x) [seq f i | i <- s] = [seq f i | i <- seq.belast x s]
SF_ly_nil : forall x0 : R, SF_ly (SF_nil x0) = [::] where ?T : [T : Type T0 : Type f : T -> T0 s : SF_seq |- Type]
map_flatten : forall (S T : Type) (f : T -> S) (ss : seq (seq T)), [seq f i | i <- flatten ss] = [seq f y | x <- ss, y <- x]
map_comp : forall (T1 T2 T3 : Type) (f1 : T2 -> T3) (f2 : T1 -> T2) (s : seq T1), [seq ssrfun.comp f1 f2 i | i <- s] = [seq f1 i | i <- [seq f2 i | i <- s]]
SF_ly_rev : forall s0 : SF_seq, SF_ly (SF_rev s0) = rev (SF_ly s0) where ?T : [T : Type T0 : Type f : T -> T0 s : SF_seq |- Type]
perm_map : forall (T1 T2 : eqtype.Equality.type) (f : eqtype.Equality.sort T1 -> eqtype.Equality.sort T2) (s t : seq (eqtype.Equality.sort T1)), perm_eq s t -> perm_eq [seq f i | i <- s] [seq f i | i <- t]
pmap_filter : forall (aT rT : Type) (f : aT -> option rT) (g : rT -> aT), ssrfun.ocancel f g -> forall s : seq aT, [seq g i | i <- pmap f s] = [seq x <- s | f x]
unzip2_snd : forall s0 : seq (?S * ?T), unzip2 s0 = [seq snd i | i <- s0] where ?S : [T : Type T0 : Type f : T -> T0 s : SF_seq |- Type] ?T : [T : Type T0 : Type f : T -> T0 s : SF_seq |- Type]
unzip1_fst : forall s0 : seq (?S * ?T), unzip1 s0 = [seq fst i | i <- s0] where ?S : [T : Type T0 : Type f : T -> T0 s : SF_seq |- Type] ?T : [T : Type T0 : Type f : T -> T0 s : SF_seq |- Type]

```coq
unfold SF_ly, SF_map.
rewrite map_comp.
rewrite <- map_flatten.
rewrite map_reshape.
unfold unzip2.
rewrite map_cat.
rewrite <- map_comp.
rewrite map_cons.
auto.
Qed.
```

original: unfold SF_ly, SF_map. rewrite map_comp. rewrite <- map_flatten. rewrite map_reshape. unfold unzip2. rewrite map_cat. rewrite <- map_comp. rewrite map_cons. auto.
